name: Chef John's Candied Yams
author: Chef John
summary: Sure, everyone knows orange-fleshed sweet potatoes aren't really yams, but it makes for a shorter name. I'm not a huge sweet side dish person, but I make an exception for these candied yams that use lemon instead of orange juice as a sweetener.
ingredients: 3 pounds orange-fleshed sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 2-inch pieces
½ cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
Chopped pistachios, pecans, or walnuts for garnish
directions: Stir salt into 2 quarts cold water in a large pot
Transfer sweet potato pieces to pot and place over high heat; bring to a simmer
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until potatoes are not quite tender but still cooked, 5 to 7 minutes
Use the tip of a knife to test for doneness
Place brown sugar, butter, lemon juice, maple syrup, ginger, cinnamon, cayenne, and pinch of salt in a skillet
Place over medium-high heat, stirring until glaze ingredients melt and start bubbling
Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until mixture begins to thicken up, 4 to 6 minutes
Transfer drained sweet potatoes to skillet
Raise heat to high and cook and stir until potatoes are coated with glaze and very tender, and glaze has thickened, 5 to 8 minutes
Transfer to serving dish; garnish with chopped nuts
